content.description: OPJ is a fun, short problem that is burly and a little dabby. Make one move off the start and jump to the lip. Mantle is powerful as well.
content.location: This problem is on the right side of Mike's Boulder. Squat start underneath lowest roof. Head straight up.

content.description: Squat start on a good left hand side pull and decent right hand undercling. Either find the good foot and shoot for the ledge or for more of a challenge use the intermediate sloper before going for the ledge.
content.location: Left side of the face. Shares a starting handhold with Mike's left.

content.description: Start on left large undercling/sidepull jug. Using sloping ridge & small pocket up & left, climb up to good sidepull higher on ridge, & dyno to high jug...top out.  Beta is very height dependant...using a knee bar to get to the small sharp pocket is a possiblity if you're exactly the right size.

Start on undercling/sidepull jug to the right.  High right foot @ arete.  Move up using sloping ridge to tiny, 2 finger skinny pocket in horizontal crack.  Large jug ledge to the right is off! Move up to next thin crack pocket & then top.
content.protection: pads, flat, but slightly down sloping landing

content.description: Start seated and use everything at your disposal to head up the face
content.location: The clean face left of the chimney

content.description: Stand start to the left of the corner and make your way up the slab. This is ”Left of get to the point” in Cargill et al
Find some crimps in the horizontal seam and trick your way to the triangular hold
content.location: On the right side of the corner

content.description: Fun crack feature with chockstone on topPictures to come soon
content.location: Just to the east of the chimney structure near MIke's Boulder (South of Mike's boulder along the trail).

content.description: A chimney the whole family can enjoy! Walk back into the chimney until you think you could start moving upwards and then wiggle your way to the top. Because it is wider in the front and narrower in the back you can choose the spot that best suits you.
content.location: Left of One Hand Jobless behind a large pine tree

content.description: Subtle and balancy. Start with a left hand on a crimp on the face, right hand on the blunt arete and follow the arete to the top.

Wisconsin Side of Interstate Park, directly across from old boat launch on Minnesota side.  Large block w/ sloping angled ridge up middle face.  Mike's Left, V7, on the left of the sloping ridge...Mike's Right, V9, to the right of the sloping ridge.
